name: Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock
description: Crash-landed on a desolate, alien planet, what should've been a routine work-for-hire job for Powell has become a deadly mission to save the merchant vessel Morningstar and her crew.

recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i3 2.4GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia GeForce GTX 550 Ti Storage: 556 MB available space

reviews.review_text: A classic point-n-click, reminding me on the good times when this genre was much more appreciated. Nice story, cool intro and outro movies, well balanced puzzles: not too hard and not too lame, you can solve everything by using your brain, but you won't need to go into annoying pixel-hunting. A really great work from such a small group of game makers. Keep on bringing more titles like this!
YouTube™ Video:  MOB Review: Morningstar Descent to Deadrock

This is an excellent adventure game that really exceeded my expectations. It is straight-forward, easy to understand, believeable story of using your wits to survive and escape the plaent you are marooned on. There is no pixel hunting, no filler puzzles, and no carzy 'who would ever do that' moments.  Atmospheric sights and sounds. Limited back and forth to locations, none of which is designed merely to fill the time. It includes trading cards amd achievements if that matters to you. The only negative I found personally is that it is too short. I would have happiily player many more hours of this game if I could.  If you like adventures you will like this!

Your starship gets caught in some sort of magnetic disturbance, and your ship is pulled down onto the surface of a planet that has a reputation of being 100% dead. Funny thing is that perhaps that's not completely true, but you are going to have to find your way through this point click adventure to find out what this planet has to hide, and are you going to be able to get off this planet in one piece.  Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is by Red Herring Labs and will take you on an hour and a half ride where you will get to explore this 'Dead Rock' and try to find anything and everything you need to potentially get off of the planet. You will have to combine items, find items, and fix issues in order to advance the game.  The one thing that I can honestly say that ended up bugging me about the game was the EXTREMELY deadpan voice of the lead actor in the game. He definitely had the almost monotone approach of not getting a damn about anything as well as never being shocked or excited about anything. That's not to say that the other voice actor was that much better, but at least they gave a little bit of feeling to the game.  I liked the look of the game, and it was pretty straightforward in how you navigated around. You are going to see almost always 1 single view of a room or an area, there might be deeper parts of the area/room that you can explore and get a new vantage point on, but this is definitely not a game where you are going to have to search every nook and cranny to find what you are looking for.  Once again, perhaps its my time away from point and clicks until recently, but there is a hint system in place, and it was good to see that it was actually useful with out making me feel dumb. There were a couple of times where I struggled to find out what to do next, but thanks to the hint system I was able to easily get back on track.  I can honestly say the further I got into the game, the more I actually got into the game. What I mean to say is that it took me a little bit of time to find the pace, but when I finally found the pace of the game I was ready to move. It was unfortunate that once I got up to speed I found the end of the game, but hey it says something that I had no issue of playing the game straight through.  So I guess the question now is should you get this game... Well I think if you are looking for something light, has a futuristic space theme, is a point click adventure built around survival, you are going to enjoy this game. As I mentioned before the only big issue I had with it was the voice acting of the main character, and before anyone asks, there are really only 2 voice actors, so that sort of didn't do it for me, but then again it wasn't like he talked the entire time. This game gets a 7.5 out of 10.

Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is a very good point and click adventure where you must explore areas of an alien planet in order to repair your crashed ship and save yourself and your captain.  The immersion factor is high, despite the static screens. It is refreshing to play a P&C game where the puzzles are logical for the most part, requiring thought as opposed to madly trying every inventory object on everything. The game world feels realistic within the realm of intelligent science fiction. For the most part, the voiceovers (the player character and the injured captain) are solid with only the occassional odd line reading.   One caveat for prospective buyers is that the game is relatively short; I achieved 100% in three hours, and I don't believe any achievements are missable. However, I feel that this is actually a good thing; the game doesn't feel bloated with ridiculous puzzles and there's hardly any backtracking. The MSRP of ten dollars is definitely worth it for the experience, especially compared to the price of a movie ticket and the length of a typical movie.  There is a demo available (and a free Flash version of the original), so if the premise and trailer appeal to you, there's no risk to try before you buy.

Pleasing, simple, if short point & click game. Figure about 2 hours to complet + all achievements.   Very nice artwork and a cool, not too over-dramatized atmosphere. Although you run across dead crew here and there, the game wasn't too gory and annoying, except maybe the captain's initial condition.   The voice work ranges from very good to quite poor, usually it's quite good but it boggles me when a voice actor doesn't know which word receives emphasis in a phrase... I can only imagine it's a general lack of reading proclivity. It happens in many games with voiceovers and this one more than usual. Still, most of the time it's fine.  The puzzles are generally easy but fairly satisfying. It's mostly linear but you do get to roam a few locations sometimes to look around and try things.   The rapport between the captain and protag is mostly good but a little cheesy at times. And a bit of animation on the captain woul have helped, it felt like you were talking to a painting at times.   Anyway I enjoyed it and finished it in 2 sittings. There was only one poor puzzle part I got stuck on, the ventilator near the generator.  But I can recommend this as a nice, short point & clicker.

Short but interesting point and click adventure. The puzzles are a bit confusing sometimes and if you want to solve everything by yourself you will have a playtime over 6 hours. That´s cool if you like the genre. If you just want to have a time killer you should buy this game when it´s on sale. Sole minus: The voice actors could have put a bit more enthusiasm into their sentences. Overall a good 'rainy-day' game.

An enjoyable straightforward point & click puzzle game set in space. You are a co-pilot who has crash landed on an alien planet & it's your job to heal your captain & repair the craft before the aliens add you to their collection.  This involves exploring the planet & other space craft to obtain the various tools & parts to repair your own & make your escape. The puzzles are fairly easy with a few tougher ones thrown in to keep you thinking (these normally involve using more than 1 part to solve the puzzle)   Pros; Storyline is fine, graphics & sound effects are ok, easy game for you achievment hunters to score 100% as your progression through the story automatically unlocks them.  Cons; Very short game, even a thicko like me completed it in under 4 hours, more experienced players will be around the 2 - 3 hour mark.   No replay value so only buy it during a sale to get the best value for your money.

Although the game inventory was minimally glitchy a few times, ones required a reload for it to access an item, I'd give the game a solid 8/10. I went in expecting a normal point and click and I am happy to say it surpassed my assumptions. The plotline left a couple of questions unanswered, maybe for a future game, but it had a very creative plotline, well made scenes, and even believable and funny characters in it.
A short, enjoyable sci-fi puzzle game with a likeable lead, a great atmospheric soundtrack, and a mysterious plot. If you like point and click adventure games, try this one out.

i usually don't go for point & click games because it bores the hell out of me to hover my mouse over every pixel on every screen if i don't want to miss important stuff and be stuck forever because of that.  but i did go for this one because a) i liked the space theme and b) i got it for free!  and in fact i quite enjoyed playing this game but it's really kind of short. like i said i'm not into that point & click stuff but even i managed to finish this game in 2 1/2 hours without overusing the help button. it's no masterpiece but it was entertaining. and even with a nice and unexpected twist i want to add.  regular point & click players may call this one casual but i really liked the straightforward type of gameplay. if you run into a problem you usually already have a pretty good idea about how to solve it. you don't need to scan the screen for tiny and barely visible items or switches and you don't need to combine ten items in the most unthinkable way to get the job done.  tl;dr: decent but short.
Decent for what it is, but know going in that it is quite short and that it ends without completing the story.

It was fun, short, but entertaining. It reminded me of 50s SciFi or like watching a Twilight Zone episode. I thought the voice acting was pretty good. Definitely added to the atmosphere. Would have been not nearly as good if you had to just read the text.

The game was good, but a little short for the price. The puzzles were a little simple, but there were a couple of good ones in there. The voice acting is terrible, but you can turn it off and just read the subtitles. The story is interesting enough as well. Took me about 2 hours to beat, and I enjoyed myself the whole time.

Very simple, relaxing hidden object game. Mixed art assets - some very good, some poor - and decent audio with good enough voice acting. Probably about an hour to two hours of content, based on your skills at adventure games. I don't necessarily think I'd pay the full price on it, but I got it in a bundle and played through it in one sitting. I enjoyed the story for what it is - feels like they thought about the world, but it doesn't go too into detail beyond the scope of the game itself.  And then had to idle the game because it is shorter than the card drop threshold.

Really enjoyed this game, everything was done well, graphics, puzzles, hints etc, would have liked it to be longer and why wouldn't it accept the alien codes ? took about 10 go's of putting the same code in before it worked? apart from that, its great, :)
A good point and clic game for a few bucks  Good stoty  nice graphics  dull voice acting fair chanllenges

This was a very short and sweet adventure game. Yes, the story is kind of cliché, but i love the charming 90's pre-rendered graphics. The puzzles are mostly simple and logic and it's very unprobable to get stuck.  Only drawback is how short it is, so it's probably best to buy while on sale.

I really enjoyed the sci-fi atmosphere and setting of this game. It kept me entertained while was playing it. If you're looking for a casual point and click adventure in a sci-fi setting, than get this game. It may not satify someone who's looking for something a bit more challenging, and like other reviewers, I would definitely reccomend getting it on sale. It took me about 3 hours and I even the sale price of $5 that I got it for, may have been a bit much. Definitely a fun title though. I love the sci-fi genre in general, but I have never been a big strategy enthusiast and most space games seem to have gameplay that is mostly built around in-depth strategy. I wish there were more quality less strategy intensive sci-fi games like this on the market.
Until I figure out why it constantly crashes...its thumbs down for me. Maybe it can be fixed???
